{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45755].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you create a project of a particular type e.g. a Business project, some Project Shortcuts are added by default. If for any reason you would not like to have this project shortcuts added by default, you would have to remember to delete them every time a new project is created, because each new project comes with the default shortcuts pre-assigned.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a way to delete or disable default project shortcuts permanently
fields.summary: Allow a way to disable default project shortcuts
Transitioning from jTDS to Microsoft JDBC Driver for JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

IE 11 is very slow when opening 700 projects from the Issue Navigator.

h3. Environment
* IE11 v 11.0.10240.16431

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created 700 projects from [data generator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-data-generator].
# Create 3000 issues of each project.
# Open IE 11 browser and login JIRA.
# Navigate to Issues menu > Search for issues > Click 'Project' column and then user to open up a list of projects and take few seconds to scroll the project lists.

h3. Expected Results
* It loads around 6 - 10 seconds.
* If you click F12, it will load longer time.

h3. Actual Results
* It should load the list of the projects as it is working fine in Chrome and Firefox.
* Chrome and Firefox took 1 ~ 2 seconds.

h3. Workaround

The only current workaround is to use a different browser.
fields.summary: IE 11 is slow to Load a Huge Amount of Projects from Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Loading search filter and doing export to CSV or HTML includes the filter's columns and not the current columns

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Issue Navigator in List View
# Save a filter
# Click on that filter from the right pane and then click on Columns 
# At Columns, Click on Filters and select 2 or 3 columns , then click Done
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# The issue navigator will show only the selected 3 columns 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Export the results to Excel ( Current fields ) and the results is expected :
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# Now go back to Column and select My Defaults, this will list all the default columns :
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
# Export the results to Excel ( Current fields ) and the results do not show all the columns from My Defaults but shows all the columns from Filter option selected earlier :
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
# The export ( current fields ) exports all the columns currently visible from the issue navigator. 

h3. Actual Results
# The export ( current fields ) includes only columns that are selected from Filter ( Column button )
 
h3. Additional Notes
# Issue also occurs on JIRA 7
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-7.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
After loading the filter, copy the JQL, click the New Search (top left corner of the Issue navigator) button and paste the JQL there, perform the search and Jira will not recognize this as a previously saved filter, allowing the Export function to correctly export the visible columns.
fields.summary: Loading search filter and doing export to CSV or HTML includes the filter's columns and not the current columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue with (at) @ mentions when attempting to add comment for user. @mentions only populates  with user's lastname and (not firstname) on 1st attempt. Issues is intermittent but reproducible. 

h3. Environment
JIRA CLOUD
7.0.0-OD-07-011JIRA CLOUD
Chrome: Version 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Instance > Open any issue and click Comment
# Type @ and 1st 3 letter of firstname > User doesn't show up.
# Remove text, try again. Type @first 3 letters of lastname > User comes up
# Remove text, try again. Type @first 3 letters of firstname > user now comes up

h3. Expected Results
User to come up with @mention with both firstname and lastname on the first try.

h3. Actual Results
User doesn't show up with firstname only with last name on first attempt. 

h3. Notes/Comments
If page is refreshed the same issue will occur and user will need to type in @lastname again for @firstname to work.

Was able to reproduce in both IE and Firefox as well. 

h3.Workaround
Type @lastname in comments for user to show up. Once user shows up you can type @firstname and user will show up in dropdown list.
fields.summary: At @mentions not working correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45750].
  {panel}

*Current Implementation*

Currently when I have more than a certain number of filters (12?  Or perhaps a dynamic number), I am only able to see _some_ of these filters when I click on the Issues dropdown.  See attached image.

*Suggested Implementation*

As a user, I would like to be able to prioritize the order of my filters, so I can determine which ones appear on the Issues.  Ideally the implementation will include at least one of the following:

- Sort order on the Manage Filters page which clearly shows which filters will be visible in the Issues menu and which won't.
- Ability to sort filters by date created on Manage Filters page and have them visible in this order on the Issues dropdown.
- By default, displaying filters on Issues menu in order of CreatedDate descending.  Older filters will be pushed off the Issues dropdown unless they are rearranged on Manage Filters page.

Thanks for listening!
fields.summary: Prioritize the order of my custom filters on the Issues dropdown menu.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45749].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When accessing JIRA from the native Windows Phone browser, the mobile site gets not displayed. Instead, users see the desktop site.

h3. Expected Results
You'd be directed to the mobile site.

h3. Actual Results
You'll see the desktop version of the site.

h3.Workaround
Users can install the UC Browser available in the [Microsoft Marketplace|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/uc-browserhd/9wzdncrfj3kn] and change the user agent:
# Go to "Web Preference (UA)" in UC browser.
# Change the user agent, select "Android" for example.
# Open JIRA, it will start with the mobile interface.
fields.summary: JIRA does not display the mobile site on Windows Phone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45748].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Corrupt caches or invalid data could occur in one or more nodes on a clustered environment (JDC). Therefore, it is not practical to shut down all nodes to refresh or clear out JIRA cache.

h4. Workaround
Restart all JIRA nodes to update the in-memory plugin related caches

h4. Proposed Solution
Provide an option to refresh plugin/application caches runtime across all nodes to prevent invalid data to be synced.
fields.summary: Provide a better way of clearing cache for JIRA Data Center (Cluster)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45747].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a new issue from JIRA and dragging and dropping an attachment, it will prevent interaction with the currently loaded issue, whether the issue is actually created or not.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit any issue in JIRA (the issue only occurs on top of another issue, not from dashboard)
# Click to *Create* a new issue
# Drag an attachment to the window, being careful not to drag it to the actual attachment panel. It must select the whole page, like this:
!Screen Shot 2015-10-12 at 16.18.58.jpg|thumbnail!
# Either submit the ticket or click cancel.
# Attempt to click anything that can usually be interacted with on the ticket that remains on the screen

h3. Expected Results
You would normally be able to click around on the issue that remains behind.

h3. Actual Results
No errors in the logs, nothing in Network Console.

h3.Workaround
* Manually attach file by clicking *Browse*
* Drag directly to attachment panel
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping attachment on inline issue creation prevents interaction with JIRA

fields.description:
We need docs for upgrading JIRA Data Center. 

Could use https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/upgrading-confluence-data-center-1507377.html as a template, seems like they are fairly similar.

h5. Upgrade steps. 
You will need to shutdown all the nodes before upgrading, and then upgrade each node one-by-one.

We would recommend to do the following steps:
# Shutdown all nodes
# Do full back-up
#* JIRA DB
#* Shared folder 
#* <JIRA_Install> binaries 
#* <JIRA_HOME> at each node
# Delete old plugin cache (<JIRA_HOME>/plugins/) at each node 
# Upgrade node 1 (uncompressing the tar file to a new directory)
# Start up node 1 (this will upgrade the DB), update all plugins to their supportive version for new JIRA version (see [Upgrade+Guide+for+JIRA+7.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Upgrade+Guide+for+JIRA+7.2] for example) and perform Full reindex.
# Copy the JIRA installation directory from node1 to node2 (keep in mind you will need to change the JIRA_HOME for node2)
# Delete the lucene index on node2 in the JIRA_HOME directory 
# Start up _node2_
# Wait for _node2_ to start-up and copy index from _node1_
# Repeat for other nodes
fields.summary: Documentation for JIRA Data Center upgrade

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45741].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
When creating new issue, I choose one of 4 Issue Types. When I choose the ? for help, a list of about 100 Issue Types comes up. This is not very helpful and confusing for users not familiar with JIRA. 

h5. Summary
We would like the "?" for the Issue Types to only show the Issue Types available to the selected project. Descriptions for each Item could be also project specific.
Attached 2 screenshots.

fields.description:
*Summary*
A JIRA Automation Plugin rule that fires on Issue Resolved event and adds a comment leaves the issue in an inconsistent state where the status is left unchanged, yet the workflow buttons show only transitions available in the Resolved state. JIRA Automation Plugin version 1.5.6

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create an automation rule as follows:
Trigger Type: Issue Event Trigger
Issue Event: ISSUE RESOLVED
JQL expression: project = "Infrastructure / Operations"
Actions: Comment Issue Action
Comment: This issue has been resolved!
Comment Visibility: Viewable by All Users
Send notification? No
# Activate the rule
# Create an issue in the Infrastructure / Operations project
# Transition issue to Resolved, select Resolution "Fixed"

*Expected Behavior*
The comment "This issue has been resolved" is added to the issue
The issue is in the Resolved state, the resolution is set to "Fixed"
The workflow buttons show only transitions available in the Resolve state
Searches for status = Open OR Resolution is Empty should NOT select this issue
Searches for status = Resolved AND Resolution is Not Empty SHOULD select this issue

*Observed Behavior*
Comment "This issue has been resolved!" is added to the issue (correct)
The issue shows as being in the Open state, the resolution shows as _Unresolved_ (incorrect)
The workflow transition buttons show only transitions available in Resolved State (inconsistent with Open status)
The History log shows the transition to Resolved statue with "Fixed" resolution (inconsistent with status)
Searches for status = Open OR Resolution is Empty DO select this issue
Searches for status = Resolved AND Resolution is Not Empty DO NOT select this issue
fields.summary: Automation Issue Event Trigger on Issue Resolved event leaves issue in an inconsistent state.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45728].
  {panel}

If I want to filter on issues that do not have a particular label in them, for example "XYZ", I expected to do this:

Labels not in (XYZ)

However this filter doesn't work correctly. It only returns issues that have labels, but those labels do not include XYZ. So issues with no labels are excluded from this filter.

To get what I want I have to do this to get the correct result:

Labels not in (XYZ) OR Labels is Empty

I did some searching and found that others have had the same issue, but I am not sure if this behavior is intended or if it is a bug that never got resolved.  Please let me know which is the case!
fields.summary: Using "Labels not in (XYZ)" in JQL Ignores Issues with No Labels

h4. +Problem+
Encoded-Word Format in an Email Subject is not parsed properly

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Set up JIRA to use a Microsoft Mail Account for Incoming Mail Server e.g. test@live.com
# Set up a Mail Handler using this mail server for Create Issue/Add Comment
# Send an email to test@live.com with this subject:
{code}=?us-ascii?Q?[Assignment] XXXXXXX has been assigned to your assignment group?={code}

h4. +Expected behavior+
Issue is created with a Summary like this:
{code}[Assignment] XXXXXXX has been assigned to your assignment group{code}

h4. +Actual behavior+
Issue is created with a Summary like this:
{code}=?us-ascii?Q?[Assignment] XXXXXXX has been assigned to your assignment group?={code}

h4. +Notes+
# If using Gmail for Incoming Mail Server, the Encoded Summary is parsed:
!issue.png|thumbnail!

#* AAA-2 uses Gmail

!livemail.png|thumbnail!
!gmail.png|thumbnail!

h4.Problem Definition

Currently, there is no way to enable *send notification* option from Labels screen by default.

h4.Suggested Solution

It would be great if admin user can enable the *send notification* option from the Labels screen globally.

h4.Workaround
# Backup JIRA.
# Open the {{labelsform.jsp}} file via {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/secure/view/issue/}} directories.
# Search for the {{id="send-notifications"}} parameter and put the entry {{value="true"}} there.
# Save the file and restart JIRA.
(i) Please do this in a staging environment and verify is working.
fields.summary: Ability to set default notification for Labels issues

fields.description:
The second option in the "Configure LDAP USER Directory" under the "LDAP Permissions" section is named in English:

"Read Only, {color:green}with{color} Local Groups"

In German the option is named:

"Schreibgeschützt {color:red}bei{color} lokalen Gruppen"

However the preposition is incorrect. "bei" is a translation of "with", but in this context it should be "mit":

"Schreibgeschützt {color:green}mit{color} lokalen Gruppen"
fields.summary: i18n error in german user directory configuration dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45713].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Not able to delete any screens because one of the screen has an invalid fieldscreen ID. Customer is modifying the field screen id of a screen in the exported workflow xml (the particular screen is used in a transition). The customer deleted the workflow in JIRA and imported the modified XML. All other screen which were deletable (and no changes were made to their fieldscreen.id) are now non-deletable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 new screens (Screen A, Screen B, Screen C)
# Create a new workflow that uses Screen C on a transition
# Export the workflow to XML
# Delete the workflow in Jira
# Edit the XML and change the screen ID for Screen C to an invalid ID
# Import the XML into Jira

h3. Expected Results
* Screen A and Screen B should be deletable. Any other screens which were deletable should have the 'delete' link and deletable.

h3. Actual Results
* Screen A and Screen B are non-deletable.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code}
2015-10-09 10:35:48,135 http-nio-8070-exec-15 ERROR admin 635x309x1 b2jps5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] METHOD: "workflowTransitionViews", exception: 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id '10322'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowActionsBean.getFieldScreenForView(WorkflowActionsBean.java:89)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AbstractJiraWorkflow.loadFieldScreenActions(AbstractJiraWorkflow.java:503)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.AbstractJiraWorkflow.getActionsForScreen(AbstractJiraWorkflow.java:487)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ViewFieldScreens.getWorkflowTransitionViews(ViewFieldScreens.java:164)
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
The workaround mentioned in the Knowledge base article [Workflow error: Cannot find Screen with id 'xxxxx'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=295305313]. Below is the summary of the workaround:

1. Search for the workflow with that screen ID with the below SQL:
{code}SELECT * FROM jiraworkflows WHERE DESCRIPTOR LIKE '%11100%';{code}

2. In the column DESCRIPTOR, there will be a line that used the screen ID from the error, for example:
{code}<action id="791" name="Resolve Issue" view="fieldscreen">
          <meta name="jira.description">1?????? ?? ???????.</meta>
          <meta name="jira.fieldscreen.id">11100</meta>{code}

3. Shutdown JIRA.

4. Update the database to change the screen ID, for example:
{code}UPDATE jiraworkflows SET DESCRIPTOR = REPLACE (DESCRIPTOR, '<meta name="jira.fieldscreen.id">11100</meta>', '<meta name="jira.fieldscreen.id">3</meta>');{code}

5. Start JIRA.

(i) If problem still exists after applying above steps, you may also need to repeat same steps to the {{jiradraftworkflows}} table.
fields.summary: Unable to delete any deletable screens after changing the fieldscreen.id of a screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In certain situations it's possible for at mentions to return users from the REST endpoint, however the JavaScript does not present them as available users in the browser. As a result of this no users can appear as mentionable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup users in a vanilla instance as follows:
{noformat}
    "name": "xcmvnx,mcnv",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "asdkalkj",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "a-train",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "black noir",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "gvbbvn",
    "emailAddress": "pxrzzkkcl@localdomain",
    "name": "hughie campbell",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "jack from jupiter",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "mister marathon",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "queen maeve",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
    "name": "starlight",
    "emailAddress": "potato@example.com",
{noformat}
# Try to at mention them using {{@p}}.

h3. Expected Results

The users appear in the browser.

h3. Actual Results

The REST endpoint returns these users, however they do not appear. As a result of this it looks like no users are returned.

h3. Workaround

Given there is a max of 10 users returned, extending the search results using {{@pe}} or similar may return the actual users. If not, attempt to mention the user by changing the search results back-and-forth, for example if you wanted to mention a 'Joey':

# Use @j
# Then @p
# Then @jo

Alternatively mentioning them by their name instead of email address will work, for example {{@mister marathon}}.
fields.summary: At mentions are not displaying returned users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45704].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a mail is sent to JIRA, if the mail lacks a body and only contains the attachment, JIRA create the issue but does not add the attachment.

In the logs, JIRA will dump the following exception:

{noformat}
2015-10-08 15:59:51,161 QuartzScheduler_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    Incoming Test [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Could not find any body to extract from the message
{noformat}

The mail that generated this exception is:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 01 Oct 2015 12:01:01 -0400
From: Some User <some_user@domain.com>
Subject: Test Email
To: <jira@mycompany.com>
Message-ID: <userbla@message-id>
Content-Type: application/pdf; name="myfile.pdf"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Description: myfile
Return-Path: some_user@domain.com
MIME-Version: 1.0

[base-64-representing-myfile.pdf-here]
{noformat}

However, if you receive the message below:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 01 Oct 2015 12:01:01 -0400
From: Some User <some_user@domain.com>
Subject: Test Email
To: <jira@mycompany.com>
Message-ID: <userbla@message-id>
Return-Path: some_user@domain.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=atlassian-test

--atlassian-test
Content-Type: application/pdf; name="myfile.pdf"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Description: myfile

[base-64-representing-myfile.pdf-here]

--atlassian-test
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii 
{noformat}

Then JIRA will create the mail successfully.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the mail handling in JIRA to accept the first type of message as some systems send mails like that. (I.E: SAP NetWeaver, SQL Server Reports)
fields.summary: Add attachments to issues from emails without body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45703].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Prior to JIRA 7.0, the date picker would highlight the current date when first opened from an issue. As of JIRA 7.0, it highlights yesterday's date instead on *Safari*, *Firefox* and *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Expected Behavior
Have the current date highlighted in the date picker, no matter which browser is used.

h3. Actual Behavior
Yesterday's date is highlighted on *Safari*, *Firefox* and *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On any field with JIRA's default date picker, click the 'calendar icon' while accessing JIRA through *Safari*, *Firefox* or *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Workaround
Manually select the date or use *Chrome*.
fields.summary: Yesterday's date highlighted in date picker

fields.description:
I am surprised that nobody cared to made this simple fix related to linking JIRA issues: When you use the insert issue link, select jira issue (if is not already selected by default), you do get an already selected input box which is supposed to include an issue key or a JQL.
Still even today, it seems that if you paste an URL to an jira issue, the application is not smart enough to map this to the issue. 

The workaround is to manually remove most of the URL in order to keep only the issue-key, quite inconvenient I would say.

If you look at the screenshot you will realise that the matching algorithm is not even able to suggest you the ticket to link, giving you another random-like one.
fields.summary: Unable to paste links into JIRA issue linker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45690].
{panel}


 

*Original request description:*

All my JIRA projects use Kanban boards as a primary user interface for all users. I see no use cases where I would want to set up JIRA without Kanban boards. The Kanban method and Kanban boards are just as useful for business projects as for software development projects. Kanban boards for business projects should preferably be free from any software jargon and hard-coded software-specific behavior. With the announcement of JIRA 7 Software, it seems that JIRA Agile boards may become even more software-specific in future releases.

Having to go for the full JIRA Software license just to get Kanban boards available in business projects is far from ideal. Higher cost is just one reason. Added complexity for users from seeing irrelevant software features and terminology is more important.

Along with many others, I have previously requested more flexible configuration options for JIRA Agile boards, in particular more dynamic filters.

Please consider adding a generic, flexible Kanban board as part of JIRA Core, or at least as an add-on.
fields.summary: Add Kanban board functionality to Jira Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install vanilla JIRA 7.0
# Create a project
# Create a task
# Create a sub-task of the task
# Import a CSV File like following
{noformat}
Summary, IssueKey, IssueType
<summary of the sub-task>, <issue key of the sub-task>, Task
{noformat}
(Please replace <...> to your sub-task's values.)

h3. Expected Results
The sub-task shouldn't appear on the parent task page after the importing.

h3. Actual Results
The sub-task appeared on the parent task page even though their issue type was updated to 'Task'. (See following screenshot.)
!parent_task.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45675].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The @mention feature uses a "contains" match for the REST query to find suggested users.  The JavaScript part of the feature uses a "starts with" match.

In some environments this means no users will be suggested even though there are users that could be shown.  This makes it hard to use the @mention feature.

Example:
* User types "@joh".
* REST API returns 10 records: [^mention-rest-joh.txt]
* Very few records are shown b/c this customer uses "LastName,FirstName" and random account IDs.

!mention-joh.png|thumbnail!


h3. Suggested Solution

* Make the JavaScript use a "contains" search just like the REST call.
* Split on "," in addition to space characters to find the parts of the Display Name.

[^mention-search-contains.patch.txt]

_(This patch could not be tested because I had trouble running JIRA from source.  It's offered to help identify the relevant code)_
fields.summary: Better matching for @mention

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a pie chart on the dashboard from the filter

h3. Expected Results

The title should be the name of the filter.

The title is “Pie Chart”.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45673].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The mention feature does not match on account email addresses.  This makes it harder to find people you want to include in work on a ticket.

Compounding the problem, matches in the email address are bolded even though this is _not_ used for the list of suggested users. See JRA-59230.


h3. Environment
* Reproduced in JIRA 6.3.12, 6.3.15, 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a fresh JIRA installation create user accounts using the data in this list: [^mention-test-users.txt]
# Go to a JIRA issue and create a comment
# Enter text "@jo" and observe which users are shown.  Also note that "jo" at beginning of the email address is shown in bold like the matches in username and full name:
!mention-jo.png|thumbnail!
# Add an "h" onto the @mention, e.g. "@joh".

h3. Expected Results

The JEDY235544 account should be shown in the list of suggested users due to match on "johnston.cory@example.com".

h3. Actual Results

The JEDY235544 account is not suggested, only the accounts where the first name, last name, or username start with "joh".

h3. Notes

We can see that the REST calls are returning 10 users using a "contains" search.  The JavaScript component searches within those results.
* [^mention-rest-jo.txt]
* [^mention-rest-joh.txt]

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the @mention JavaScript component search on email addresses. [^option1-SearchEmail.patch.txt]

In the meantime, we should stop bolding matches in the email address. [^option2-NoEmailBolding.patch.txt]. See JRA-59230.

_(I was unable to test the patches because I had trouble running JIRA from source.  I hope they are helpful to illustrate the problem.)_
fields.summary: Mentions should support finding users with a matching email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45668].
  {panel}

When doing instance-wide cleanup work, the 'Inactive' toggle on the Workflows page is a significant hindrance. 

Each time an action is taken on a workflow from the inactive section, the 'Workflows' screen is refreshed, and the Inactive toggle is set to collapsed. That means to delete 10 workflows, we have to do the following 10 times:

   # Scroll to bottom of page
   # Toggle 'Inactive' tab to show inactive workflows
   # Locate the target workflow
   # Delete the target workflow
   # Confirm the deletion

After each deletion confirmation, we have start from step 1 again because the inactive toggle is collapsed and we cannot see the other <N> workflows that we wish to act on.

For lower skilled administrators this causes confusion especially when working with workflows of similar names. When they have expanded the inactive workflows and taken an action, they expect the inactive workflows to remain displayed, and may accidentally work on a similarly named active workflow when a search fails to find the workflow they are looking for.
fields.summary: Remember user's choice of inactive setting on Workflows page

JIRA displays created date as if user was in daylight saving time (+ 1 hour)

fields.description:
*The case:*

In our apps, where we include collector, we want to set default values for name and email fields, so user does not have to type it by hand. It can be easily done because we have user context within application.

*The problem:*

When user is logged in to Jira those default values overrides real user's identity, so issue's reporter would be set based on name/email fields, +not+ on user's Jira session.

In our organization each user has many email aliases, so it is possible that email from app context will be different to Jira's account email. So finally, if we set default email when configuring collector and user is logged in, but has different email on Jira, we can lose some reliable data because reporter in this issue could be default assignee (default email not matched) instead of real Jira user.

*Possible workaround:*

It could be possible to bypass this problem if determining user on the JS level (when configuring collector) would be possible. Real data isn't even required, only boolean flag if user has session. I have tried many ways, but most of them are blocked by same origin policy. I also wanted to get user from {{X-AUSERNAME}} header (additional request to collector's configuration), but without success.

*Real solution:*

Use Jira's session instead of name/email values passed from collector, especially since  clicking "not you" does not allow to provide name and email (JRA-32342 / JRA-38869).
fields.summary: Issue Collector: Default values for name/email overrides real (logged in) user's identity

fields.description:
Problem was discovered through the Workflow Integrity checker, which reported "UNFIXABLE ERROR: The issue with key ABC-123 has a status of StatusB which is not a valid status for the issues workflow. (JRA-8326)"

Problem can be reproduced by following these steps:
# create an issue of type A
# go into edit mode and leave the edit window open
# in another browser window, edit the issue and change the issuetype to B which has a different workflow from A
# in the same window, change the status to a value which doesn't exist in the issuetype A workflow, call it StatusB
# go back to the first edit window, make a change and save
# reload the view issue screen

You end up with a type A issue with status StatusB, which does not exist in the type A workflow. The View Workflow button does not work, and the issue cannot be moved to any other status. The history shows that the first issue type change (A to B) was accompanied by the expected workflow change, but the second issue type change (B to A) did not have an associated workflow change because it happened via the issuetype being overwritten rather than through a proper issue type change.

JIRA should handle this simultaneous-edit scenario in a way that prevents the issue from getting stuck in an invalid state.
fields.summary: Simultaneous edit with issuetype change can cause workflow problems

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA labels add-ons that are not compatible with the current version of the application but keeps the add-ons enabled.
This can cause some incompatible add-ons to break JIRA entirely, causing unexpected problems.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could disable these add-ons automatically with the option to manually enable them to avoid unexpected problems

h3. Unable to add watchers to the view issue screen if multiple watchers are specified. 

h3. Environment
* Any browser with a landscape display option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the window in landscape mode.
# Specified 22 users (enough to make sure a decent list size). 
# Click watchers from the view issue screen. 

!Safari.png|thumbnail!
!firefox.png|thumbnail!
!chrome.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The window would populate  in landscape as it does in portrait toward the bottom. 

h3. Actual Results
The window populates toward the top not allowing the ability to add a watcher from the view issue screen. 

h3.Workaround

Click More on the view issue tab panel, select watchers, then add a watcher.

!more.png|thumbnail!
!add.png|thumbnail!

Does not happen in portrait mode. 

!portriat.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to add watchers from the view issue screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The [JIRA Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] documentation provides guidance on what driver to use with Oracle 11g, however it does not provide any guidance for what driver to use with Oracle 12c.

The driver that is bundled with JIRA (11.2) is the likely to be the tested driver, but there is not too much guidance around this so further documentation in this area would be helpful. 

While Oracle states that 11.2 will work with Oracle 12c, the documentation also includes a table that shows JDBC Driver versions vs JDK: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_03. I see JDK 8 is not listed with 11.2.

h3. Suggested Solution
Document the correct Oracle Driver to use (that which has been tested).

h3. Workaround 
Use the bundled Oracle Driver.
fields.summary: Document the correct Driver version to use with Oracle 12c

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45635].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Relying on MIME type information regarding JIRA issue attachments supplied by browsers can often be unreliable, causing JIRA to store attachment data with wrong MIME types in the database. This could lead to minor issues on how this attachments should be handled when downloading from the issue since the content-header is set wrongly based on the wrong MIME type recorded in the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
A minor validation e.g. based on known file extensions should be used to determine the most appropriate file type when storing attachment data.
 
h3. Notes 
* It initially appeared JIRA already had such a feature based on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-871. However after a report from a customer, I was able to personally reproduce a scenario where JIRA basically stores the wrong MIME type (text/pdf instead of application/pdf) when a PDF file was uploaded to JIRA using Firefox with corrupt MIME type definitions library. Basically this caused issues when downloading the pdf files in other browsers because the browsers tried to render the PDF file as a text file based on the content headers sent by JIRA, resulting in gibberish characters outputted on the screen.
fields.summary: Validate attachment MIME type before storing in database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go through all steps to configure an import from external system (tested with Bugzilla, doesn't happen with CSV);
# Import the data;
# When the import completes, click *save the configuration*;

h3. Workaround
h5. Option #1
Upgrade JIRA to version 6.4.12 or later, which includes version 7.0.20 of JIM.

h5. Option #2
Downgrade JIM to version 7.0.11, which can be downloaded [from here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin/version/308].

h5. Option #3
Downgrade JIM to version 7.0.15, which can be downloaded [from here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin/version/338]).
(!) _Version 7.0.15 also contains a bug where projects already created lead to a {{NullPointerException}} as well. So, please create a new project before importing data from an external system._
fields.summary: NullPointerException when saving import configuration
Add a warning to the bulk move operation identifying the timeout can occur

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45627].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* User is unable to search for versions ( using the browser's search function CTRL + F ) at the bottom of the page ( is there if a long list of versions ) without scrolling the page. 
* Bug ticket has been created here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45626

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a built in search function to search versions on the Versions page.
fields.summary: Build in Version Search
